title: Can ezreal q not proc kleptomancy?
body:
Ezreal as been responsible for runeglaive removal and as been abusing multiple item for a long time. I wouldn't like to see a fun rune get nerfed because 1 champion abuses it hardcore. 
(Gankplank is good with it; but grasp is better for him IMO)

replies.body:
>Ezreal as been responsible for runeglaive removal

No he really wasn't.  Runeglavie built from a SHEEN, there are tons of AP junglers that DON'T want a SHEEN. So that's what got it removed.

This is wrong. Ezreal smite-runeglaive mid allowing him to overcome his greatest weakness as a midlaner (waveclear) very early and cheaply was the problem. The fact it built from sheen was irrelevant - more AP junglers are happy to get a sheen item (Nida, Fizz, Diana) than not (essentially just Fiddle, in the other side).

However Runic Echoes is still good on all of the former group and also for the latter, and isn't useful on midlane Ezreal so doesn't skew the meta. So it works on several levels.

No, he was right.

The item was removed because not all AP junglers could actually use it effectively, since not all of them have synergy with Spellblade, or with auto-attacking.  It was also abused by solo laners like Ezreal.

Considering how specific Ezreal Q's is and how just equally specific Kleptomancy is explained, it's evident that it's intended for him and GP and such peeps to proc it whenever.

Wether that's a good idea or not is another matter.

Kleptomancy was deliberately designed as a spellbade proc. This would be like his q not proccing trinity force.

I also find that it makes lane ez somewhat viable. Without this interaction we would only be seeing jg ez, half of which would be going dark harvest.

I like seing ez go bot, but kleptomancy was meant for supports so they could get more gold or items after using an auto attack. Kleptomancy act's like a sheen effect and procs for ezreal and gankplank q. Auto-attack isn't a spell so i see this as another ezreal abuse case.

Kleptomancy and the rest of the runes in the inspiration tree were never intended for a specific role . Learn to play against it or use it yourself or just ban ezreal .
For the record a lot of champions not just ezreal are using this keystone so your basis of stating that its just ezreal abusing this is completely incorrect. You can literally abuse the ezreal as well he sacrifices some dmg to go this path. Ezreal hasnt been that great in the lane phase for some time now and now he has something he can use to bring him back  i see nothing wrong with it. Need to learn to adapt the meta changes all the time .

Only time will tell if you and me are wrong. It's preseason and i find it interesting that some spell can apply kleptomancy. You are right about kleptomancy not applying to a specific class though. Just me being used to see bandit on supports only.
